metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3618 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: ALPACA is an application layer protocol content confusion attack, exploiting TLS servers implementing different protocols but using compatible certificates, such as multi-domain or wildcard certificates. A MiTM attacker having access to victim's traffic at the TCP/IP layer can redirect traffic from one subdomain to another, resulting in a valid TLS session. This breaks the authentication of TLS and cross-protocol attacks may be possible where the behavior of one protocol service may compromise the other at the application layer.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the mail proxy mechanisms aren't included in nginx.conf by default

criterions.comment: nginx: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
sendmail: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
vsftpd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
